tit.cmt: 登録用語ですが、system of multi-capitalの用例は1例も見つかりませんでした（google books）。multi-capital systemとしました。

sen.j: 複都制（ふくとせい）は、国家に複数の都を置く制度。
sen.e: The system of multi-capital is a system which places plural capitals in one nation.
The multi-capital system is a system which places plural capitals in one nation.
sen.cmt: 登録用語ですが、system of multi-capitalの用例は1例も見つかりませんでした（google books）
sen.e: The multi-capital system is a system which places plural capitals in one nation.

sen.j: 広大な領土を有する国に多く採用され、2つの場合は両都制、両京制とも言われる（これに対して都をひとつだけ置く制度を単都制という）。
sen.e: This system is adopted by a nation of vast land and the case of placing two capitals is called Ryotosei or Ryokyosei. (On the other hand the case of one capital is called Tantosei.)
This system is adopted by a nation of vast land and the case of placing two capitals is called Ryotosei or Ryokyosei, (while the case of one capital is called Tantosei).
sen.cmt: 一セル一文にするため、(while～に変更しました。
sen.e: This system is adopted by a nation of vast land and the case of placing two capitals is called Ryotosei or Ryokyosei, (while the case of one capital is called Tantosei).

sen.j: また、国家の首都機能を複数の都市に置く制度にもいわれる。
sen.e: This system is also used for the system in which capital functions are placed in several cities.
This system also refers to the system in which capital functions are placed in several cities.
sen.cmt: is used for → refers to に変更しました。(is used forは多少意味が違ってくると思います。）
sen.e: This system also refers to the system in which capital functions are placed in several cities.

sen.j: 現代的な複都制については首都複都制を参照。
sen.e: Regarding the modren mullti-capital system, refer to Shutohukutosei.
Regarding the modren mullti-capital system, refer to Shutohukutosei.
Regarding the modren mullti-capital system, refer to Shutohukutosei.

sen.j: 中央集権国家の複都制では、皇帝が常住する京や都を上京・上都・京城・皇都・京師などと言い、その他の都を陪都（ばいと）という。
sen.e: In the centralized government,the palace or the capital where the emperor always resides is called kamikyou, joto, kyojo,or kyoshi and other capitals are called baito (secondary capital city).

In the multi-capital system of centralized government, the palace or the capital where the emperor always resides is called kamikyo, joto, kyojo,or kyoshi and other capitals are called baito (secondary capital city).
sen.cmt: kamikyou → kamikyo （指示書の表記指示により）In the multi-capital system of を追加しました（訳抜け）
sen.e: In the multi-capital system of centralized government, the palace or the capital where the emperor always resides is called kamikyo, joto, kyojo,or kyoshi and other capitals are called baito (secondary capital city).

sen.j: しかし陪都に対応する語句は西洋になく、これは東洋的なものとされる（陪都制）。
sen.e: In western culture, there is no word for baito. So this is considered to be something Oriental.
But, in western culture, there is no word corresponding to baito, so this is considered to be the system unique to the Orient (baito system).
sen.cmt: for → corresponding toに変更（対応するを表現するため）(陪都制）訳抜け一セル一文にするため、ピリオドをカンマに、Soを小文字に変更しました。something Oriental→system unique to the Orient (表現を変更しました）Butを追加しました（しかしの訳抜け）
sen.e: But, in western culture, there is no word corresponding to baito, so this is considered to be the system unique to the Orient (baito system).

sen.j: 日本史で言われる難波遷都などは、正確には天皇の陪都巡守や皇都昇格であり、都を移す遷都とは異なる。
sen.e: The transer of the capital like Naniwa sento written in Japanese history precisely means a visit to baito by the emperor or advancement of the city to a higher position. so it does not mean the transer of the capital.

The transfer of the capital like Naniwa sento (relocation to Naniwa) in Japanese history was a visit to baito by the emperor or advancement of the city to a higher position to be correct, so it was different from the transfer of the capital.
sen.cmt: writtenを削除しました（自然な表現にするため）transer → transfer スペルミスの訂正とは異なるの訳をdifferent fromに変更しました。難波遷都 (relocation to Naniwa)と説明を追加しました。
sen.e: The transfer of the capital like Naniwa sento (relocation to Naniwa) in Japanese history was a visit to baito by the emperor or advancement of the city to a higher position to be correct, so it was different from the transfer of the capital.

sen.j: 皇帝が陪都に滞在し、皇帝不在の皇都で国政をみさせるために代理を置くときは、権限を制限したうえで太子を置いたり（太子監国の制）、信頼の厚い重臣などの有力者を置いたりした（留守官の制）。
sen.e: When the emperor stayed in baito, prince or powerful persons like reliable senior vassals substituted for the emperor to govern the nation, though their power was limited.(Taishikankokuno sei or Rusukanno sei)

When the emperor stayed in baito, prince or powerful people like reliable senior vassals substituted for the emperor to govern the nation, though their power was limited.(Taishikankokuno sei or Rusukanno sei, respectively)
sen.cmt: 原文の語順と異なりますが、カッコをまとめるほうが自然なためrespectivelyを追加しました。
sen.e: When the emperor stayed in baito, prince or powerful people like reliable senior vassals substituted for the emperor to govern the nation, though their power was limited.(Taishikankokuno sei or Rusukanno sei, respectively)

tit.e: system of multi-capital in the Roman Empire
Multi-capital system in the Roman Empire
tit.cmt: 登録用語ですが、system of multi-capitalの用例は1例も見つかりませんでした（google books）
tit.e: Multi-capital system in the Roman Empire

sen.j: 2世紀後半、ローマ帝国では正帝と副帝による分治が起こり、ディオクレティアヌス帝の時代に帝国が東西に分けられ、2人の正帝と2人の副帝によってテトラルキアされた。
sen.e: In the latter half of the 2nd century, the Roman Empire was govrned by the emperor and the vice emperor. In the period of emperor Diocretianus, the Empire was divided into the west and the east, which were governed by two emperors and two vice emperors.

In the latter half of the 2nd century, the Roman Empire was governed by the emperor and the vice emperor, and during the time of emperor Diocletianus, the Empire was divided into the west and the east and governed by two emperors and two vice emperors.
sen.cmt: the 2nd century → the second centurygovrned → governed一セル一文に反するため文章を変更しました。ディオクレティアヌスのミススペルを訂正しました Diocletianus
sen.e: In the latter half of the 2nd century, the Roman Empire was governed by the emperor and the vice emperor, and during the time of emperor Diocletianus, the Empire was divided into the west and the east and governed by two emperors and two vice emperors.

sen.j: これによりニコメディア、シルミウム、メディオラヌム、アウグスタ・トレウェロルムの4都が置かれ、ローマは首都機能を失ったが、名目的には帝国の都として続いた。
sen.e: Because of this, four capitals were placed in Nicomedia, Sirumium, Meduiolanum and Augusta Treverorum respectively. Rome lost its capital functions,but nominally remained as a capital.

Because of this, four capitals were placed in Nicomedia, Sirumium, Meduiolanum and Augusta Treverorum respectively, and Rome lost its capital functions but nominally remained as the capital of the Empire.
sen.cmt: 一セルに２つ文があったため、一文にするため変更しました。
sen.e: Because of this, four capitals were placed in Nicomedia, Sirumium, Meduiolanum and Augusta Treverorum respectively, and Rome lost its capital functions but nominally remained as the capital of the Empire.

sen.j: その後、西方正帝コンスタンティヌス1世が帝国を統一し、東方に新都コンスタンティノポリスを建てた。
sen.e: After that, Constantinus 1, the emperor of the west Rome united the nation and constructed a new capital, Constantinople in the east.
After that, Constantinus I, the emperor of the West, united the Empire and constructed a new capital, Constantinople in the east.
sen.cmt: 英数字の１ではなくローマ数字のⅠに変更しました。(定訳による）
sen.e: After that, Constantinus I, the emperor of the West, united the Empire and constructed a new capital, Constantinople in the east.

sen.j: 395年には、東帝テオドシウス1世（西帝は形式的に幼い次男ホノリウス）の死により、長男アルカディウスが東帝とされ、都が東のコンスタンティノポリスと西のメディオラヌム（後にラヴェンナへ遷都）に置かれ、東西二分が進むことになった。
sen.e: In 395 due to the death of Theodosius 1. the East Roman emperor, his first son, Arccadius, became the emperor of theEast, while the West was formally governed by his younger second son, Honorius. Two capitals, one in Constantinople of the East and the other in Mediolanum (later to Ravenna) of the West were placed, which resulted in building a two divided country.

Due to the death of Theodosius I, the emperor of the East (with his young second son Honorius being the emperor of the West as figurehead) in 395, his first son Arccadius became the emperor of the East, and the two capitals were placed, one in Constantinople in the East and the other in Mediolanum (later to Ravenna) in the West, which promoted the Roman Empire to be divided into the West and the East.
sen.cmt: 上記セルの表記にあわせるため、Theodosius Iに変更しました。１セル１文に変更、andで結びました。原文にあわせるためカッコ内の表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Due to the death of Theodosius I, the emperor of the East (with his young second son Honorius being the emperor of the West as figurehead) in 395, his first son Arccadius became the emperor of the East, and the two capitals were placed, one in Constantinople in the East and the other in Mediolanum (later to Ravenna) in the West, which promoted the Roman Empire to be divided into the West and the East.

sen.j: これらをローマ帝国が東西2国に分裂したとするのは誤りである。
sen.e: It is not correct to determine that the Roman Empire was divided into two contries, the West and the East. Even though in the 4th century when divided governing became clear, and was called the emperor of the West or the country of the West, it was not officially called the Western Empire. The Roman Empire actually controlled both lands.
It is not correct to consider that the Roman Empire was divided into two countries; the West and the East.
It is not correct to consider that the Roman Empire was divided into two countries; the West and the East.

sen.j: 4世紀に分治の色が濃くなったものの、当時「西の皇帝」「西の領土」などとは言われても「西ローマ帝国」とは言われず、あくまで「ローマ帝国」の分割統治であった。
sen.e: Even though in the 4th century divided governing of the country became more evident and the West of Rome was called as "the emperor of the West" or "the territory of the West", it was not officially called the Western Roman Empire and "the Roman Empire" was considered to govern the both territories.
sen.cmt: １原文１訳文例外対処＋セル内の２つの文章を一文に修正しました。of the countryを挿入しました。 原文にはありませんが、the West of Romeを挿入しました（より自然な英語にするため）clear →more evidentに変更（より自然な英語として）あくまでの訳がactuallyは逆だと思います。
sen.e: Even though in the 4th century divided governing of the country became more evident and the West of Rome was called as "the emperor of the West" or "the territory of the West", it was not officially called the Western Roman Empire and "the Roman Empire" was considered to govern the both territories.

tit.cmt: 登録用語ですが、system of multi-capitalの用例は1例も見つかりませんでした（google books）

sen.j: 中国の南北朝時代 (中国)、北周は長安を都とし東方の洛陽を陪都とする複都制をとった。
sen.e: In a period of Nanbokucho in China, Northern Zhou adopted multi-capital system and located the capital in Changan and a secondary capital city in Luoyang in eastern China.
In the period of the Northern and the Southern courts in China, Northern Zhou adopted multi-capital system and located the capital in Changan and a secondary capital city in Luoyang in eastern China.
sen.cmt: 南北朝In a period of Nanbokucho in China →In the period of the Northern and the Southern courts in Chinaに変更しまいた（定訳）
sen.e: In the period of the Northern and the Southern courts in China, Northern Zhou adopted multi-capital system and located the capital in Changan and a secondary capital city in Luoyang in eastern China.

sen.j: 隋もこれを引き継ぎ、唐の723年（開元11年）には、長安・洛陽（東都）に北都として太原を加え三京になった。
sen.e: Sui applied the same system and in 723, added Taiyuan (as the capital in the north) to Tang and Luoyang and had three capitals.
Sui applied the same system and Tang had three capitals by making Taiyuan as the capital in the north in addition to Changan and Luoyang (the northern capital) in 723.
sen.cmt: 原文解釈が誤っていると思います。723年はすでに王朝は唐に変わっています。長安、（東都）訳抜け
sen.e: Sui applied the same system and Tang had three capitals by making Taiyuan as the capital in the north in addition to Changan and Luoyang (the northern capital) in 723.

sen.j: 757年（至徳2年）には更に鳳翔（西京）、成都（蜀郡）が加えられ五京を持つに至ったが、この2都は間もなく廃された。
sen.e: In 757, two more capitals, Fomsiamen (in the west) and Chengdu (in shoku county) were added. However, these two capitals were abolished soon.
In 757 Tang added two more capitals, Fengxiang (the western capital) and Chengdu (in Shu County) and thus had five capitals, but these two capitals were abolished soon.
sen.cmt: セルに文が２つあるので一文に統合しました。五京を持つにいたったが→訳抜けのため追加しました。蜀郡 shoku county → Shu County （英語読みに変更しました）西京→西方にある都 western capital鳳翔→Fengxiang (訳文のFomsiamenはラテン語表記でここで使用するのは不適切です）
sen.e: In 757 Tang added two more capitals, Fengxiang (the western capital) and Chengdu (in Shu County) and thus had five capitals, but these two capitals were abolished soon.

sen.j: これらの中でも洛陽は、食糧に乏しい長安に比べて食糧が豊富なため、皇帝は皇太子に長安で監国させ、たびたび洛陽に巡幸した。
sen.e: Since Luoyang, among these capitals, was rich in food,compared to Changan, the emperor often visited there, with the prince watching the country for the emperor in Changan.
Among these capitals, Luoyang was richer in food than Changan, so emperors often visited there, with princes staying in Changan to govern the country on behalf of emperors.
sen.cmt: 自然な英語にするために文章を変更しました。
sen.e: Among these capitals, Luoyang was richer in food than Changan, so emperors often visited there, with princes staying in Changan to govern the country on behalf of emperors.

sen.j: 特に武則天はその治世の間は長安にほとんど行かず洛陽の都に住んでいた。
sen.e: Especially emperor Busokuten resided in Luoyang during most of his reign.
Especially Empress Wu Zetian resided in Luoyang during the most of her reign.
sen.cmt: 武則天は女帝なのでempress、herが適当。 用語はBusokutenになっていますが、英語にすべきだと思います。Empress Wu Zetian (名字の確認ができなかったのでそのままで表記しています）
sen.e: Especially Empress Wu Zetian resided in Luoyang during the most of her reign.

sen.j: このように洛陽は重要な陪都として長安と並び両京と称された。
sen.e: Therefore, Luoyang became an imortant secondary capital city and was also called the capital with Changan.
Thus Luoyang became an important secondary capital city, and, along with Changan, was referred to as two-capital.
sen.cmt: 文章を一部変更しました
sen.e: Thus Luoyang became an important secondary capital city, and, along with Changan, was referred to as two-capital.

sen.j: その後、明の南京市・北京市、清の北京・南京・盛京、その他渤海 (国)、遼、金 (王朝)では五京が置かれた。
sen.e: Since China is a vast country, and often invaded by enemies, multi-capital system was popular.For example, Nanjing city and Beijing city were the capitals in Ming Dynasty and Beijing city, Nanjing city and Shenjing city were the capitals in Shin Dynasty. In the nation of Blahae and Liao and Kin Dynasty five capitals were placed.

In later periods, Ming had Nanjing City and Beijing City as capitals, and Ching had Beijing, Nanjing and Shenjing, while some other countries or dynasties had five capitals such as Balhae (country), Liao and Jin (Dynasties).
sen.cmt: セル内に二つの文章があるため、一原文一訳文例外対処としました。翻訳は文の順序が違っているので原文にあわせました。清の訳をShinからChingに訂正しました。（Qingという呼称もあります）「その後」が訳抜け「 金王朝」のスペルミス修正自然な言い回しにするためsome other countries or dynastiesを挿入しました。
sen.e: In later periods, Ming had Nanjing City and Beijing City as capitals, and Ching had Beijing, Nanjing and Shenjing, while some other countries or dynasties had five capitals such as Balhae (country), Liao and Jin (Dynasties).

sen.j: 中国は領土が広く外敵の進入が多いため複都制が盛んであった。
sen.e: Since China is a vast country and had been often invaded by enemies, multi-capital system was widely adopted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Since China is a vast country and had been often invaded by enemies, multi-capital system was widely adopted.

sen.j: また、日中戦争で首都南京を放棄した際には、一時的に首都機能を移した重慶市を陪都と称した。
sen.e: During th Sino-Japanese war,when Nanjing was abandanded, and Chongquing city,where the capital functions were temporarily moved, was designated as a secondary capita cityl.
During the Sino-Japanese war, when the capital of Nanjing was abandoned, Chongquing city was called as a secondary capital city where the capital function was temporarily moved.
sen.cmt: スペルミス修正、文章の順序を変更しました。andを削除
sen.e: During the Sino-Japanese war, when the capital of Nanjing was abandoned, Chongquing city was called as a secondary capital city where the capital function was temporarily moved.

sen.j: 渤海
sen.e: Balhae
Balhae
Balhae

sen.j: 渤海 (国)では、次の五京が置かれた。
sen.e: The following 5capitals were placed in the kingdom of Balhae.
The following five capitals were placed in the kingdom of Balhae.
The following five capitals were placed in the kingdom of Balhae.

sen.j: 上京竜泉府（現在の黒竜江省牡丹江市寧安市渤海鎮）
sen.e: Shangjing Ryusen fu (Balhae, Ning'an city, Mudanjang city, Heilongjiang Province, today)
Shangjing Longquanfu (Balhae, Ningan City and Mudanjang city, Heilongjiang Province today)
sen.cmt: 上京竜泉府→上京のみ英訳し竜泉府は日本語読みで残すのは不自然なので英語読みに変更しました。
sen.e: Shangjing Longquanfu (Balhae, Ningan City and Mudanjang city, Heilongjiang Province today)

sen.j: 東京竜原府（吉林省琿春市八連城）
sen.e: Zhongguo ryugen fu (Hacherenjo Kishun city, Jilin Sheng Province, today)
Dongjing Longyuanfu (Baliancheng, Hunchun City, Jilin Province today)
sen.cmt: 英語表記とローマ字読みが混在しているのですべて英語表記に変更しました。東京はZhongguo(※中国の事になってしまいます）ではなくDongjinが正しい表記です。shengは省のことなので、英語表記の場合 Jilin Province か Jilin Shenと表記し、Jilin Sheng Provinceという用例はほとんどありません。
sen.e: Dongjing Longyuanfu (Baliancheng, Hunchun City, Jilin Province today)

sen.j: 中京顕徳府（吉林省和竜市）
sen.e: Hyundeok kentoku fu (waryu city, Jilin Sheng Province today)
Zhongjing Xiandefu (Helong City, Jilin Province today)
sen.cmt: 中京顕徳府（吉林省和竜市）英語発音表記に変更しました
sen.e: Zhongjing Xiandefu (Helong City, Jilin Province today)

sen.j: 南京南海府（朝鮮民主主義人民共和国清津市付近）
sen.e: Nanjing nankai fu (near Shintsu city in North Korea, today)
Nanjing Nanhaifu (near Chongjin City in North Korea today)
sen.cmt: 南京南海府（朝鮮民主主義人民共和国清津市付近）すべて英語表記に変更
sen.e: Nanjing Nanhaifu (near Chongjin City in North Korea today)

sen.j: 西京鴨緑府（吉林省臨江市）
sen.e: Seogyeong Yalu fu (Linjiang cityJilin Sheng Province, today)
Xijing Yalufu (Linjiang City, Jilin Province today)
sen.cmt: 西京鴨緑府（吉林省臨江市）の表記を訂正しました
sen.e: Xijing Yalufu (Linjiang City, Jilin Province today)

sen.j: 北宋
sen.e: Northern Sung Dynasty
Northern Sung Dynasty
Northern Sung Dynasty

sen.j: 北宋は、次の4つの都を置く四京制を敷いた。
sen.e: In north Sung Dynasty the following 4 capitals were placed.
In north Sung Dynasty the following four capitals were placed.
In north Sung Dynasty the following four capitals were placed.

sen.j: 東京開封府（現在の開封市）
sen.e: TokyoKaifeng fu (Kaifeng city today)
Dongjing Kaifengfu (Kaifeng City today)

sen.e: Dongjing Kaifengfu (Kaifeng City today)

sen.j: 西京河南府（洛陽市）
sen.e: Seogyeong fu (Luoyang city today)
Xijing Henanfu (Luoyang city today)

sen.j: 南京応天府（河南省商丘市）
sen.e: Nanjin oten fu (Shokyu city Kanan Province today)
Nanjing Yingtianfu (Shangqiu City, Henan Province)

sen.j: 北京大名府（河北省邯鄲市大名県）
sen.e: Beijing Damingu fu (Damingu Prefecture, Handan city,Heibei Province, today)
Beijing Damingfu (Daming County, Handan City, Hebei Province today)
sen.cmt: 北京大名府（河北省邯鄲市大名県）英語表記に統一しました府はPrefectureではなくCounty
sen.e: Beijing Damingfu (Daming County, Handan City, Hebei Province today)

sen.j: 遼
sen.e: Liao
Liao
Liao

sen.j: 遼は、国土を次の五道 (行政区画)に分け、それぞれに副都を置いた。
sen.e: Liao divided the country into the following Godo (five administrative divisions) and eah devision had a secondary capital.
Liao divided the country into the following five circuits (dao)(administrative divisions) and each dao had a secondary capital.
sen.cmt: Godo → five circuits (dao)に変更、ミススペルを修正しました。
sen.e: Liao divided the country into the following five circuits (dao)(administrative divisions) and each dao had a secondary capital.

sen.j: 上京臨潢府（現在のバイリン左旗南波羅城）
sen.e: Shangjing Rinko fu (Rajo Sakinanpa Bairin today)
Shangjing Linhuangfu (Balin Zuoqi Nanbo Luocheng, Inner Mongolia today)
sen.cmt: 上京臨潢府（現在のバイリン左旗南波羅城）を英語表記に変更、Inner Mongoliaを追加しました。
sen.e: Shangjing Linhuangfu (Balin Zuoqi Nanbo Luocheng, Inner Mongolia today)

sen.j: 東京遼陽府（遼陽市）
sen.e: Tokyo ryoyo fu (Rryoyo city today)
Dongjing Liaoyangfu (Liaoyang City today)
Dongjing Liaoyangfu (Liaoyang City today)

sen.j: 中京大定府（赤峰市の南、河北省との境あたり）
sen.e: Zhongjing Dading fu (around south of Chifeng city and Hebei Province)
Zhongjing Dadingfu (around the south of Chifeng City and the border of Hebei Province)
sen.cmt: 中京大定府（赤峰市の南、河北省との境あたり）
sen.e: Zhongjing Dadingfu (around the south of Chifeng City and the border of Hebei Province)

sen.j: 南京析津府（北京市）
sen.e: Nanjing fu (Beijing today)
Nanjing Xijingfu (Beijing City today)
Nanjing Xijingfu (Beijing City today)

sen.j: 西京大同府（大同市）
sen.e: Seogyeong Dading fu (Dading city today)
Xijing Dadingfu (Dading City today)
Xijing Dadingfu (Dading City today)

sen.j: 朝鮮の複都制
sen.e: multi-capital system in Korea
multi-capital system in Korea
multi-capital system in Korea

sen.j: 高麗王朝は、正都開京（開城）に、東京（慶州）、西京（平壌）を加え三京とした。
sen.e: In Goryeo Dynasty, there were three capitals, Gaegyeong (in Kaesong), Tokyo (in Gyeonsang) and Saikyo (in Pyongyang).
In Goryeo Dynasty, there were three capitals; Gaegyeong (Kaesong), Donggyeong (Gyeonsang) and Seogyeong (Pyongyang).
sen.cmt: 東京、西京 表記を修正しました
sen.e: In Goryeo Dynasty, there were three capitals; Gaegyeong (Kaesong), Donggyeong (Gyeonsang) and Seogyeong (Pyongyang).

sen.j: 15代粛宗の時代の1010年に、南京（漢城、現在のソウル特別市）を加え四京とした。
sen.e: In 1010, under the rule of 15th emperor Shukuso Nanjing (Seoul today) was added, then the Dynasty had 4 capitals.
In 1010, under the rule of 15th emperor Sukjong, Namgyeong (or Hanyang, Seoul today) became the capital, which made four-capital system.
sen.cmt: 事実関係に矛盾があります。高麗の１５代皇帝粛宗の在位は1095年から1105年です。高麗の南京はNamgyeong、漢城が訳抜けでした。
sen.e: In 1010, under the rule of 15th emperor Sukjong, Namgyeong (or Hanyang, Seoul today) became the capital, which made four-capital system.

tit.cmt: ミスで原文が消えていたので挿入しました。

sen.j: 古代の日本では唐を強く意識して複都制が採られた。
sen.e: In ancient times Japan followed Tang's example, adopting multi-capital system.
In ancient times, Japan, which was strongly influenced by Tang, adopted multi-capital system.
sen.cmt: 強く意識して 訳抜け
sen.e: In ancient times, Japan, which was strongly influenced by Tang, adopted multi-capital system.

sen.j: 孝徳天皇が難波宮に移ったとき、そして天智天皇が近江大津宮に移ったときにも飛鳥の京（倭京）は保存されており、それぞれ飛鳥との二都であった。
sen.e: When emperor Kotoku moved to Naniwa kyu palace and when emperor Tenji moved to Omiotsumiya palace, Asukano kyo palace (Wa kyo palace) was preserved,so there were two palaces then.
When the Emperor Kotoku moved to Naniwa-kyu Palace and the Emperor Tenji moved to Omi Otsu no miya Palace, Asuka no kyo (Wakyo) was maintained, so there were two capitals; Asuka and the other.
sen.cmt: 飛鳥の京は宮都をさすのでpalaceを削除しました。Wa kyo palace → Wakyopreserve → maintained
sen.e: When the Emperor Kotoku moved to Naniwa-kyu Palace and the Emperor Tenji moved to Omi Otsu no miya Palace, Asuka no kyo (Wakyo) was maintained, so there were two capitals; Asuka and the other.

sen.j: 天武天皇は683年（天武12年）に以下のように詔した。
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu said in 683,"The palace is't necessarily one and I am going to build two palaces..
Emperor Tenmu announced in 683 as follows:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「以下のように」を加えてsplitしました。said → announced
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu announced in 683 as follows:

sen.j: 「凡そ都城宮室は一処にあらず、必ず両参を造らん。」
sen.e: "The capital and palace should not be one, so I will build more than one."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処解釈として、「一箇所だけでなく２，３はあるべき」としました。
sen.e: "The capital and palace should not be one, so I will build more than one."

sen.j: 「故に先ず難波を都とせんと欲す。」
sen.e: Then I'd like to designate Naniwa as a capital firstof all".
"Therefore I am going to make Naniwa as capital first."
"Therefore I am going to make Naniwa as capital first."

sen.j: そして、難波を飛鳥とともに都とした。
sen.e: Naniwa became the capital with Asuka.
As a result, Naniwa became the capital along with Asuka.
sen.cmt: そしてをAs a resultとして訳しました。
sen.e: As a result, Naniwa became the capital along with Asuka.

sen.j: 聖武天皇は平城京・難波京の他に、木津川 (京都府)を挟む形で恭仁京の造営を計画した。
sen.e: Emperor Shomu planned to construct Kuni kyo palace (located on the other side of the Kizu river) besides Heijo kyo palace and Naniwa kyo palace.(Probably he planned to construct two palaces,Naniwa kyo palace and Kunikyo palace, because Daigokuden and corridors of Heijo kyo palace were used to construct Kuni kyo palace).
Emperor Shomu planned to construct Kuni-kyo (located on the other side of the Kizu river [Kyoto Prefecture]) besides Heijo-kyo and Naniwa-kyo.
sen.cmt: この場合、難波京、恭仁京、平城京ともpalaceではなくcapitalの意味だと思います（用語による）セルに文章が２つあるので、一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Emperor Shomu planned to construct Kuni-kyo (located on the other side of the Kizu river [Kyoto Prefecture]) besides Heijo-kyo and Naniwa-kyo.

sen.j: （ただし平城京の大極殿と歩廊を恭仁京に移築しており、難波との二都の計画とも考えられる）。
sen.e: (However, Daigokuden and the corridors in Heijo-kyo were dismantled and reconstructed in Kuni-kyo, so it could be considered that the initial plan was two-capital system of Kuni-kyo and Naniwa.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処文章の順序を原文に近づけるため修正しました。
sen.e: (However, Daigokuden and the corridors in Heijo-kyo were dismantled and reconstructed in Kuni-kyo, so it could be considered that the initial plan was two-capital system of Kuni-kyo and Naniwa.)

sen.j: これは当時洛水をまたいで造営されていた唐の洛陽城に倣ったものと考えられる。
sen.e: This is considered to follow an example of Luoyng caslte in Tang. Luoyng castle was located across Rakusui.
This is considered to follow the Luoyng Castle in Tang, which was built across the Luo River.
sen.cmt: セル内の文章が２つあるので一つに統合しました。洛水→the Luo River
sen.e: This is considered to follow the Luoyng Castle in Tang, which was built across the Luo River.

sen.j: 淳仁天皇は平城・難波に加え、北京として保良京を設けた。
sen.e: Emperor Junjin built Horano kyo palace as a north palace besides Heijo and Naniwa.
Emperor Junjin built Horano-kyo as the northern capital besides Heijo and Naniwa.
sen.cmt: 北京 Northern capital としました。
sen.e: Emperor Junjin built Horano-kyo as the northern capital besides Heijo and Naniwa.

sen.j: これは唐の北京太原に倣ったものと思われる。
sen.e: This seems to be a copy of Beijingt Taiyuan inTang.
It is assumed to have followed Beijing Taiyuan inTang.
sen.cmt: It is assumed に変更しました。
sen.e: It is assumed to have followed Beijing Taiyuan inTang.

sen.j: 761年（天平宝字5年）造営された保良京は間もなく廃された。
sen.e: Horano kyo palace was abolishied in 761.
Though built in 761, Horano-kyo was soon abandoned.
sen.cmt: 解釈ミス（造営されたのが761年ですが、翻訳では廃されたのが761年の意味になっています）
sen.e: Though built in 761, Horano-kyo was soon abandoned.

sen.j: 称徳天皇は由義宮を造営し西京としたが、これもすぐに廃された。
sen.e: Emperor Shotoku built Yugimiya palace as a west palace, but was abolished shortly.
Empress Shotoku built Yugenomiya detached palace as the western capital, which was also soon abandoned.
sen.cmt: Emperor Shotoku → Empress ShotokuYuginomiya→Yugenomiya Detached Palace （用語により）
sen.e: Empress Shotoku built Yugenomiya detached palace as the western capital, which was also soon abandoned.

sen.j: しかし793年（延暦12年）には桓武天皇により永らく陪都であった難波宮が廃されており、これにより日本の複都制は一旦途絶え、長い単都制の時代に移行した。
sen.e: In 793 Emperor Kanmu abolished Naniwa gu palace, a secondary palace for a long period of time, which resulted in terminating multi-capital system, adopting single capital from then.

In 793 Emperor Kanmu abolished Naniwanomiya Palace which had been a secondary capital for a long period of time, as a result Japan discontinued the multi-capital system and shifted to single-capital system that has lasted long.

In 793 Emperor Kanmu abolished Naniwanomiya Palace which had been a secondary capital for a long period of time, as a result Japan discontinued the multi-capital system and shifted to single-capital system that has lasted long.

sen.j: 日本では歴史的に複都制に対する理解が浅い。
sen.e: In Japan multi-capital system is not familiar to people historically. Before Heian period, people considered the place where the emperor resided to be a capital. So when the emperor visited and stayed at a secondary capital for long, they thought that the capital moved there.
In Japan the people historically had a shallow understanding of multi-capital system.
sen.cmt: セル内の文章が３つあるので一原文一訳文例外対処としました。原文は二つにsplitしました。
sen.e: In Japan the people historically had a shallow understanding of multi-capital system.

sen.j: 平安以前でも国民は天皇の御座のあるところを都ととらえ、陪都への行幸もその滞在が長ければ遷都と呼んだ。
sen.e: Before Heian period, the people considered that the capital was the place where emperor resided, and when emperor extended the stay in secondary capital during the visit, they regarded it as a transfer of the capital.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Before Heian period, the people considered that the capital was the place where emperor resided, and when emperor extended the stay in secondary capital during the visit, they regarded it as a transfer of the capital.

sen.j: また、こうした皇都と陪都の区別の曖昧さが日本の複都制の特色とされる。
sen.e: This unclear distinction between a capital and a secondary capital is a character of multi-capiital system inJapan.
This unclear distinction between a capital and a secondary capital is a character of multi-capiital system in Japan.
This unclear distinction between a capital and a secondary capital is a character of multi-capiital system in Japan.

tit.cmt: 以降の訳をinからsinceに変更しました。

sen.j: 1868年の「江戸ヲ称シテ東京ト為スノ詔書」により、江戸が「東京」と改称された。
sen.e: Accoring to the Imperial Rescript in 1868, Edo was renamed Tokyo.
Accoring to the Imperial Rescript in 1868, Edo was renamed Tokyo.
Accoring to the Imperial Rescript in 1868, Edo was renamed Tokyo.

sen.j: 同年、江戸城が天皇行幸の皇居と定められ、事実上の遷都が実施された。
sen.e: In the same year, Edo castle was determined the Imperial Palace and the capital moved to Tokyo.,
In the same year, Edo-jo Castle was made to be the imperial palace for the emperor to move to Tokyo, which was de-facto transfer of the capital.
sen.cmt: 文章を変更しました(事実上が訳出されていなかったため）
sen.e: In the same year, Edo-jo Castle was made to be the imperial palace for the emperor to move to Tokyo, which was de-facto transfer of the capital.

sen.j: しかし遷都が公式に宣言されたことは一度もなく、法制度上は東京と京都（平安京）の両京制であるとする議論が一部に存在する。
sen.e: But an official announcement of the transfer of the capital has never been made. So some claim that both Tokyo and Kyoto (Heiann kyo) are capitals legally.
But an official announcement of the transfer of the capital has never been made, so some claim that both Tokyo and Kyoto (Heiann kyo) are legally capitals.
sen.cmt: セル内に文章が2つあるので一つにしました。
sen.e: But an official announcement of the transfer of the capital has never been made, so some claim that both Tokyo and Kyoto (Heiann kyo) are legally capitals.

sen.j: 東京に対する西の京は京都であるが、京都のことを「西京」と呼ぶことは稀である（東京奠都直後に短期間だけ呼ばれた）。
sen.e: Kyoto (capital of the West) contrasts Tokyo (capitl of the East).But Kyoto is rarely called "Nishikyo". (It was called so only for a short period soon after the capital transfered to Tokyo).
Kyoto is the capital of the West in contrast to Tokyo, but Kyoto is rarely called "西京" (Saikyo) and was called so only for a short period immediately after the capital was moved to Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一つのセルに３つの文章があるため、文章を修正しました。自然な表現にするため文章を変更しました。括弧は表記しませんでした。
sen.e: Kyoto is the capital of the West in contrast to Tokyo, but Kyoto is rarely called "西京" (Saikyo) and was called so only for a short period immediately after the capital was moved to Tokyo.

sen.j: 室町時代に栄華を極めた山口市のことを「西の京都」という意味で西京（さいきょう、にしのきょう）と呼んだが、東京に対比させた呼び名ではなかった。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, Yamaguchi city, which flourished most during the period, was called Saikyo, meaning a capital of the West, but the name was not against Tokyo.
Yamaguchi City, which flourished the most during the Muromachi period, was called "西京" (Saikyo or Nishi no kyo), meaning Kyoto in the West, but it was not named in contrast to Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 対比させた againstではなく in contrast to にしました。文章を変更しました。
sen.e: Yamaguchi City, which flourished the most during the Muromachi period, was called "西京" (Saikyo or Nishi no kyo), meaning Kyoto in the West, but it was not named in contrast to Tokyo.

sen.j: 現在も西京銀行や山口県立西京高等学校などの名残がある。
sen.e: Today the word of "Nishikyo" remains in some names like Bank of Nishikyo or Yamaguchi Prefecture Nishikyo high school.
Today the word of "Nishikyo" or "Saikyo" remains in several places such as the Saikyo Bank and Yamaguchi Prefectural Saikyo Senior High School.
sen.cmt: 読みは「にしきょう」ではなく「さいきょうぎんこう」、「さいきょうこうとうがっかこう」です。
sen.e: Today the word of "Nishikyo" or "Saikyo" remains in several places such as the Saikyo Bank and Yamaguchi Prefectural Saikyo Senior High School.

sen.j: 因みに、京都府立大学の旧称は西京大学だった。
sen.e: By the way,the old name of Kyoto Prefectural University was Nishikyo University.
In addition, the old name of Kyoto Prefectural University was Saikyo University.
sen.cmt: ちなみにの訳をBy the way→In additionとしました（正確には違いますが）京都府立大学の旧称は「さいきょうだいがく」です。
sen.e: In addition, the old name of Kyoto Prefectural University was Saikyo University.
